name: A Child’s Place

contact.address: 601 E. Fifth Street Suite 230 Charlotte, NC 28202

description: There are more than 4,000 homeless children in CMS. A Child’s Place works to erase the impact of homelessness on children and their education. By providing educational and emotional support as well as medical referrals, children are able to stay in the classroom.

opportunities.name: Snack Packs
opportunities.address: 601 E. Fifth Street Suite 230 Charlotte, NC 28202
opportunities.description: Compile snack bags for children. Each snack pack will include 3 items: juice (prefer 100% juice boxes, but capri suns are also great), carb (crackers, granola, bars, breakfast bars, etc.), fruit (fruit cup, applesauce, fruit snacks). Bags should be lunch size brown bags.

opportunities.name: Snack Pack Program Support
opportunities.address: 601 E. Fifth Street Suite 230 Charlotte, NC 28202
opportunities.description: Assist us in our main office with office projects. Organizing resource rooms and snack deliveries. We are always in need of assistance at our front desk.

opportunities.name: Be a Bunny Program
opportunities.description: The Be A Bunny program is a great way to provide Easter Baskets to children in need in our community. Volunteer groups put together Easter Baskets that include the traditional candy, small games and stuffed animals and also include items that these children need like school supplies, socks, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc.

opportunities.name: Lunch or Breakfast Buddy
opportunities.description: Provide a mentoring friendship for a child. Volunteer comes to school to meet with their assigned “buddy”.

opportunities.name: Tutor
opportunities.description: Assist students with homework, prepare for tests, or help with reading/math skills.

opportunities.name: Classroom Assistant
opportunities.description: Assist teacher with facilitating classroom activities. Responsibilities include tutoring, leading small groups, art projects, checking papers, and other helpful tasks.

opportunities.name: Snack Deliveries
opportunities.description: Transport snacks from the ACP main office to specific CMS school sites.

name: Aldersgate
description: Aldersgate is an older adult community that offers independent, assisted and a skilled nursing care living facility. They have a variety of volunteer opportunities available for groups of all ages

opportunities.name: Interactive Activity
opportunities.description: Plan a fun and interactive activity for the seniors living at Aldersgate (games, singing, arts & crafts, themed parties, etc.)

name: Big Brothers/Big Sisters

contact.address: 3801 E Independence Boulevard, Suite 101, Charlotte, NC 28205

description: The Big Brothers Big Sisters mission is to provide children facing adversity with strong and enduring, professionally supported 1-to-1 relationships that change their lives for the better, forever.

opportunities.name: Big Brother or Big Sister
opportunities.description:
For a few hours, a couple times a month, you can give a Little the invaluable gift of
your friendship. By simply changing their perspective of what the world can offer, you can literally start changing their lives. And sometimes it’s as simple as playing video games, going to a museum, or just hanging out together.

opportunities.name: First Impressions
opportunities.description: Greet guests and visitors upon arrival at the office; answer phones and route calls; assist with administrative tasks.

name: Boys & Girls Club (The Salvation Army Carolinas)
description: The Boys & Girls Club provides a positive and safe environment for disadvantaged children after school and during the summer months.

opportunities.name: Club Assistants
opportunities.description: Volunteers will interact with 40+ children when they arrive from school, assist with homework for 45 minutes and then play games. You may also take refreshments - ice cream party, cupcakes & punch, cookies & lemonade, etc.

opportunities.name: Mentor
opportunities.description: Volunteers to mentor children from single parent families to provide one on one friendship in the community based and school based programs. Male volunteers are extremely encouraged to apply in the community based program as the large majority of children are boys.

opportunities.name: Tutor
opportunities.description: Volunteers are needed to assist students ages 5-17 with reading and homework in the afterschool programs.

name: Center of Hope (The Salvation Army Carolinas)
description: Charlotte’s only 24/7 year-round emergency shelter for women and children. The Center of Hope has 280 beds and routinely operates at capacity. The Center of Hope is the largest such shelter in the Southeast, the Center of Hope offers a comprehensive program of on-site services, including the nation’s only Boys & Girls Club within a homeless shelter.

opportunities.name: Kitchen Volunteers
opportunities.description: All volunteers should be 12 years or older to be in the kitchen. Younger children may participate in serving drinks or helping with other needs out of the kitchen area with adult supervision. Breakfast 6:45am Mon-Fri and 7:30am Sat-Sun; Lunch 12:00pm; Dinner 5:00pm. If you are helping to serve a meal, please arrive 15 minutes before meal time. If you are helping to prepare a meal, please arrive at least 90 minutes before meal time. 5-10 people.

opportunities.name: Child Care
opportunities.description: We are in need of volunteers to help care for the children between the hours of 9-12, Monday-Friday. The extra assistance in the classroom will give more moms the chance to take advantage of the various services offered at the Center of Hope and provide a safe and fun environment for their little ones!

opportunities.name: Tutor
opportunities.description: The Center of Hope has the unique privilege of having a Boy’s and Girl’s Club on-site and available for school age children K-12. The boys and girls here are in need of tutors to assist in homework assignments from 5-6pm, Monday-Thursday. This extra help is just what the kids need to succeed academically.

opportunities.name: Job Readiness Training
opportunities.description: Show Up For Life program is on the look-out for relatable and caring guest speakers who can share job readiness skills with the class. Such topics might include: interview skills, goal-setting, resume building, dressing for success, etiquette, etc. Show Up For Life takes place Monday-Thursday in the mornings on a four week cycle.

name: Charlotte Family Housing
description: Charlotte Family Housing provides supportive transitional shelter and affordable housing for families in several locations; Plaza Place, Hawthorne Place and various church congregations within the Family Promise program.

opportunities.name: Prepare & Serve Meals, General Activities
opportunities.description: Volunteers are needed to provide and serve meals for the up to six families living there. Volunteers can also help with cleaning, plan a craft for the kids, or host a game night.

opportunities.name: General Maintenance
opportunities.description: Volunteers are needed for yard work, indoor painting, cleaning and minor maintenance work.

opportunities.name: General Activities
opportunities.description: Groups are needed to organize activities such as craft projects, pizza and movie night, Wii game time or cookie baking. Volunteers can also assist with tutoring children or providing computer instruction. Landscaping flower planting and vegetable garden creation/maintenance are also needed volunteer activities.

name: Charlotte-Mecklenburg County Parks
description: Help make our county beautiful.

opportunities.name: Neighborhood Park Beautification
opportunities.description: Volunteers are needed to help clear trails of debris, pick-up litter, spread mulch, etc.

opportunities.name: General Activities/Maintenance
opportunities.description: Assisting in school grounds beautification – landscaping, etc.

name: Crisis Assistance Ministry
description: Crisis Assistance Ministry helps families facing financial crisis by: providing for basic needs with rent and utility assistance, clothing, household goods, furniture and appliances; fostering financial stability through partnerships, counseling, and support to give families the tools they need to move toward stability; and educating the community about the realities of poverty in Mecklenburg County.

opportunities.name: Free Store Inspectors & Sorters
opportunities.description: Volunteers are needed to receive donations, sort clothing, inspect clothes for quality, and hang clothing. As part of the project, you could hold a clothing drive prior to visiting the agency. Men’s clothes and larger sizes are greatly needed.

opportunities.name: Breakfast or Lunch Ministry
opportunities.description: Team volunteers provide food and beverages for customers in line in the morning or in the lobby during Breakfast or lunch at Crisis Assistance Ministry. Groups are asked to provide individually wrapped breakfast or lunch items to 200 people.

opportunities.name: Relocation Assistance
opportunities.description: Teams load, transport, and unload furniture and household goods for families leaving homelessness.

opportunities.name: Donation Door Attendants
opportunities.description: Help donors in the Donation Drive-Thru by receiving donations and sharing genuine appreciation for material goods donations for the Free Store.

opportunities.name: Furniture Bank Customer Service
opportunities.description: Assist customers with picking out furniture items and will be trained to answer customer and community phone inquiries.

opportunities.name: Furniture Bank Donation Collectors
opportunities.description: Help once a week, once a month or “on-call” to pick up donations from individuals and businesses in the community. Volunteers who have their own truck are especially needed, though volunteers are also needed to ride on agency trucks.

name: Classroom Central
description: Classroom Central’s mission is to equip students living in poverty to effectively learn by collecting and distributing free school supplies. We do this via four programs: a Free Store where teachers can “shop” for free school supplies, a Mobile Free Store which distributes supplies quarterly to geographically further districts, our Classroom Up online ordering program and a Backpacks and Basics program which targets the highest poverty schools in our region. Classroom Central supports over 200 schools in six school districts: Charlotte-Mecklenburg, Gaston, Iredell-Statesville, Kannapolis, Lancaster and Union. When equipped with the proper supplies, we believe there’s no limit to what children can achieve.

opportunities.name: Teacher Shopping Assistant
opportunities.description: Assist teachers with check-in/out, answer questions and load items into teachers’ vehicles and other tasks as needed. Monday, Tuesday and Thursday afternoons. As part of your volunteer project, you could consider holding a school supply drive. Pencils and ink pens are always in great need.

opportunities.name: General Help
opportunities.description: Stocking – sorting, counting, packing and placement of supplies for distribution to teachers. Die Cutting - cutting, packaging and labeling stencils for use by teachers.

name: Sow Much Good
description: Sow Much Good (SMG) was founded to eliminate socio-economic, racial, and ethnic health disparities that result from a lack of access to nutritionally dense food products in marginalized populations. SMG works to achieve food justice through programming and community based initiatives designed to provide equal access to organic food sources; to inspire individuals to take charge of their health and to promote healthy lifestyles through food and nutrition. - See more at: http://www.sowmuchgood.org/about-us/#sthash.lKDKm3M6.dpuf

opportunities.name: Gardening
opportunities.description: Volunteers will help with weeding, planting, watering, organic pest management, composting and harvesting activities.

name: Friendship Trays/Gardens
description: Friendship Trays is a private, nonprofit agency that delivers more than 500 meals daily to elderly and homebound recipients in the Charlotte area. Due to individual’s dietary restrictions, they specialize in 15 modified diets.

opportunities.name: Gardening
opportunities.description: Volunteers will help with weeding, planting, watering, organic pest management, composting and harvesting activities.

opportunities.name: Prepare & Pack Meals
opportunities.description: The Kitchen Helpers put the food in containers so it is ready for the drivers. Some chopping, slicing, or dicing may be required. Some volunteers will help seal, label and distribute the meals to the volunteer drivers

opportunities.name: Meal Delivery
opportunities.description: Drivers allow an hour and a half to drop off the meals to the individuals on a route. In that time, volunteers deliver much more than food: The deliver a smile, a helping hand, and a daily visit from someone who cares.

name: Love INC
description: Love INC provides home repairs and maintenance to elderly, disabled and low income individuals who are not able to pay for minor home repairs. Services include minor carpentry, handrails, bath grab-bars, minor repairs, wheelchair ramps and various types of yard work and maintenance.

opportunities.name: Ramp It Up
opportunities.description: Work along side a licensed contractor to build a wheel chair ramp for someone in need.

opportunities.name: House Cleaning/ Grocery Shopper
opportunities.description: Provide house cleaning or assist with grocery shopping for someone who cannot complete the tasks on their own. Most of the clients live in the 28273, 14, 03, and 09 zip codes. All volunteers must be affiliated with a church and must provide your own transportation.

name: Men's Shelter of Charlotte
description: The Men’s Shelter of Charlotte provides safe emergency shelter while working to end homelessness. MSC operates two shelters and provides, meals, clothing and support services including substance abuse counseling and housing and employment assistance.

opportunities.name: Lunch Coordinator
opportunities.description: Plan, purchase, prepare and serve lunch for the men at the Shelter. This project is much easier than it sounds and not expensive at all to do.

name: NC Med Assist
description: There are more than 167,000 uninsured people in Mecklenburg County. NC MedAssist's mission is to assist these low-income, uninsured North Carolina residents by operating a licensed pharmacy that provides free medications, healthcare advocacy and related educational services.

opportunities.name: Over the Counter Give Away Day
opportunities.description: Disitributing over the counter medicine to individuals in need.

name: Our Towns Habitat For Humanity
description: Habitat for Humanity brings people together in partnership to provide safe, decent and affordable housing solutions for families and communities in need.

opportunities.name: Construction Volunteers
opportunities.address: Locations Vary - Cornelius, Davidson, Hungersville, Mooresville
opportunities.description:
Volunteers will help with construction tasks. Depending on the week, tasks will vary (framing, set trusses, sheath roof, doors & windows, vinyl siding, drywall, painting, interior trim, hardware, and landscaping).
Number of volunteers: 1 to 30 (depends on task). Must be at least 16 years old. No one under the age of 16 will be permitted on the building site while work is beingdone(youthages12to15canvolunteerforlandscapingifaccompaniedbyaparentorguardian). Volunteersages12to17 must bring a waiver form signed by a parent/guardian to the jobsite. No one under 18 will be allowed to use power equipment, work on a ladder, the roof or participate in any hazardous activity.

opportunities.name: Office Volunteers
opportunities.description: Data entry, filing, volunteer hospitality

opportunities.name: ReStore Volunteers
opportunities.description: Volunteers will help with stocking, registers, and donation drop off. Between the hours of 9am-5pm (Saturday) Minimum age requirement for volunteers (supervised by a parent) is 16 years old

name: Safe Alliance - Clyde and Ethel Dickson Domestic Violence Shelter
description: Safe Alliance assists over 12,000 people annually throughout Mecklenburg County and Lake Norman. We also reach thousands more through our educational and prevention programs as well as institutional advocacy efforts.

opportunities.name: Kitchen Volunteers
opportunities.description: We are looking for help in the kitchen to prepare, serve and clean up from meals. We serve three meals a day to our residents, so lots of teams are needed.

name: Second Harvest Food Bank
description: Second Harvest Food Bank supplies a network of over 500 nonprofit agencies and churches with food and essential grocery products. These agencies are comprised of emergency pantries, homeless shelters, soup kitchens, group homes for the handicapped, low income day care centers, and other similar programs serving low-income people.

opportunities.name: Food Sorting
opportunities.description: Volunteers will help sort food and other grocery products to ensure they are ready for distribution to area agencies. As part of the project – you could host a food and/or pet food drive.

name: Supportive Housing Communities
description: The mission: Supportive Housing Communities (SHC) provides permanent affordable housing to alleviate homelessness and human suffering. We support previously homeless men, women and children permanently at housing three sites.

opportunities.name: Provide a Meal (Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner)
opportunities.description: Provide meal for 70- 80 people. We have space for meal set up, serving tables, two gas grills for cook out and small kitchen for some prep. Meals must be prepared offsite and delivered for set up or utilize our gas grills for outdoor cook outs. Disposable plates, cups, napkins and utensils are needed.Up to 15 volunteers maximum (Children 12 and older are welcome when accompanied by an adult)

opportunities.name: In Kind Donation Organization & Inventory
opportunities.description: Organize and inventory in kind donation storage closet and assist in donation distribution.

opportunities.name: Cleaning Day
opportunities.description: Come join the residents during spring, fall or winter/holiday cleaning project. Cleaning project may include; cleaning kitchens, sweeping and mopping floors, dusting and light household cleaning. Spring cleaning is in March, fall cleaning is in September and winter cleaning is in early November, prior to holidays; dates to be announced. (4-5 hour volunteer time)

opportunities.name: Community Garden at McCreesh Place
opportunities.description: Vegetable garden at McCreesh Place needs spring and fall cleanup and planting. Early spring and late fall; dates to be announced. (2-3 hour volunteer time)

name: The Relatives
description: The Relatives is a system of resources that helps children and youth find shelter and support. The crisis center is a nine bed co-ed shelter for youth in crisis (runaway/homeless) ages 7 – 17.

opportunities.name: Dinner with The Relatives
opportunities.description: Provide dinner for the youth and staff at the Crisis Center. There are 9 children and 2 staff. You can either drop off dinner, or stay and have dinner with the group.

name: YMCA
description: The YMCA Mission is to put Christian principles into practice through programs that build healthy spirt, mind and body for all.

opportunities.name: Afterschool
opportunities.description: Play some of your favorite games, help with homework, or even share a book with a student

opportunities.name: Active Older Adults
opportunities.description: Join us as we celebrate our senior adults as they exercise, garden, take field trips, create art during their craft time, hear guest speakers and engage in devotions – or lead a unique group activity.

name: YWCA Central Carolinas
description: Fifty weeks each year during after school hours, school holidays and during the summer, eleven YWCA Youth Learning Centers open their doors to over 360 youth from at risk communities, ages five to 12. The Youth Learning Centers offer youth a safe, educational and fun environment, with a variety of activities from swimming and storytelling to field trips and arts and crafts.

opportunities.name: Youth Learning Center
opportunities.description: Volunteer groups will provide up to 25 (30 depending on the center. Two of our centers have up to 45 children.) children with refreshments (of your choice) when they arrive from school, assist with reading, homework, and play games.Takeabook(s)toreadwiththekidsandthenleavethebookbehindfortheircontinuedenjoyment. Thesegroup volunteer activities will be subject to the YLC Coordinator's approval. (Refreshment suggestions: ice cream party, cupcakes & punch, cookies & lemonade, etc.) You could do themed refreshments and/or arts & crafts if your visit coincides with a holiday.

opportunities.name: Be a Bunny Program
opportunities.description: The Be A Bunny program is a great way to provide Easter Baskets to children in need in our community. Volunteer groups put together Easter Baskets that include the traditional candy, small games and stuffed animals and also include items that these children need like school supplies, socks, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc.

name: Communities in School
description: The mission of Communities In Schools (CIS) is to surround students with a community of support, empowering them to stay in school and achieve in life.

opportunities.name: Mentor/School Buddy
opportunities.description: Serve as a student’s role model, motivator, and personal advocate, or simply be a friend during lunch.

opportunities.name: Career Coach
opportunities.description: Speak about your career experience to a group of students or host a job shadowing field trip.

opportunities.name: School Aid
opportunities.description: The School Aide contributes to providing a high quality learning environment through assisting staff with administrative tasks, classroom and/or media center support, or teacher appreciation activities throughout the school year. A School Aide with a particular interest in working with teen parents and pregnant teen girls can also act as a support to CIS Case Managers during the facilitation of group sessions.

name: Community Link
description: Community Link provides programs for individuals and families to obtain and sustain safe, decent, and affordable housing.

opportunities.name: Volunteer Tax Aide
opportunities.description: Prepare and e-file tax returns for low-to-moderate income wage earners.

opportunities.name: Financial Coach
opportunities.description: Work with customers in the Homeless to Housing program to help plan and fulfil their financial goals (including debt management, savings, basic money management, budget, and restoring or establishing positive credit) – available placements in Mecklenburg, Rowan, Davidson, Stanley, Union, and Cabarrus Counties.

opportunities.name: Welcome Crew
opportunities.description: Welcome a formerly homeless family to their new home - with a provision of supplies. Perhaps it's a bed and bath basket; children's needs; or just basic household supplies. Groups collect the items for either delivery to Community Link or for their staff to pick up. Items are distributed to their customers.

name: Hope Haven
description: Hope Haven, a foundation of recovery, provides life skills for homeless, chemically dependent adults and families within a supportive residential environment, leading to independence.

opportunities.name: Apprentice Program Partners/Career Coaches
opportunities.description: Provide on the job training experience to a Hope Haven resident and enable them to advance their skills and obtain viable employment. Work with resident to set goals and provide guidance for a successful transition.

opportunities.name: Childcare / Babysitter
opportunities.description: Provide childcare for infant or child on-site in the residential Families Program, while moms/dads attend classes or runs errands.

opportunities.name: Computer Training/Tutor
opportunities.description: Help bridge the digital divide, and work with residents who need improvement and/or knowledge of a specific computer program. Work with residents on GRE prep, class, or college course.

name: Latin American Coalition
description:
La Coalición is a community of Latin Americans, immigrants and allies that promotes full and equal participation of
all people in the civic, economic and cultural life of North Carolina through education, celebration and advocacy.

opportunities.name: Women's Advocate
opportunities.description: Women’s advocates are court advocates that act as part of a support system for female victims of domestic violence. volunteers operate on an “on call” basis; 6 month commitment required.Fluent in Spanish and English, excellent interpersonal skills, problem

opportunities.name: Tax Assistance Interpreter
opportunities.description: The Latin American Coalition will provide bilingual services specifically for Spanish speakers who need help filing their taxes.

opportunities.name: Christmas Fill a Stocking Program
opportunities.description: Surprise a boy or girl Christmas morning with a stocking filled with goodies. There are hundreds of stockings that need filling. Groups can shop individually or together and then plan a time to fill the stockings – maybe while listening to holiday music or watching your favorite holiday movie. For information call 980-297-0518.

opportunities.name: Silver Bells Program
opportunities.description: The Silver Bells program helps over 500 senior citizens (age 60+) each year, providing them with needed clothing, shoes, toiletries and other items in which a fixed income cannot provide.

name: Legal Services of Southern Piedmont
description: The mission is to ensure a full measure of justice for those in need. LSSP provides a wide range of civil legal assistance to eligible low-income persons in the Charlotte metropolitan area and west-central N.C.

opportunities.name: Pro Bono Attorney
opportunities.description: We are always in need of pro bono attorneys who are dedicated to helping us serve more clients in legal crisis.

opportunities.name: Volunteer Navigator
opportunities.description: We are seeking volunteers who can offer guidance and assist individuals in signing up for new health insurance plans made available by the Affordable Care Act. This is a great opportunity to be a part of health care reform and help individuals in our community obtain healthcare coverage.

opportunities.name: Interpreter / Translator
opportunities.description: We have ongoing opportunities for translator/interpreters who are fluent in a second language, especially volunteers who are fluent in Spanish.
